Question: A 34-year-old lady presents with a long-standing offensive discharge from the ear and on  examination is noted to have a reduction in her hearing of 40 decibels compared to the opposite  side.

A 4-year-old is brought to the general practitioner by her mother. She has been distressed with  ear pain for the past 14 hours. She is constantly touching and pulling at her ear, Whilst she is sat  in the waiting room her mother notices a discharge of foul-smelling fluid from the ear, following  which the pain resolves

A-4-year-old child is brought to the clinic by his father, They are concerned because she has been noted to have a small epithelial defect anterior to the left ear and is has been noted to  discharge foul smelling material for the past 2 days.
A 70-year-old male presented with. Neck rubbery mass with axillary and inguinal masses with splenomegaly what is the most common cause of neck masses?
Option 3: Squamous cell carcinoma in her tongue

Question: A 60-year old man presents with a one-month history of headache, confusion and recent onset of right sided hemiparesis. A CT scan demonstrates a 3-4 cm lesion with central necrosis in the left frontal lobe. It is seen extending across the midline along the corpus callosum. There is extensive edema around the lesion. Which of the following is the most likely diagnosis of this lesion?
A week after surgical elevation of the zygomatic arch a 19 year old man returns with hearing  loss vertigo and clear fluid exuding from the external auditory meatus?

A 4 year old man complains of increasing headache, associated with nausea and vomiting  especially in the morning He has no focal neurological sings but ophthalmic examination  showing bilateral papilledema. Which of the following in the most likely diagnosis?

A 60 years old man presents to the emergency department wit epistaxis, The source of the  bleeding is identified as littie's area and resolves with direct cautery. Which vessel is most likely  responsible for bleeding?
A 56-year-old man presents with symptoms of nasal pain, anosmia and rhinorrhoea with pain in his eye ball He has been well until recently and has worked as a wood carver for many years.

A 32-year-old female presents with recurrent episodes of rhinorrhoea; the discharge is watery. She has a medical history of asthma and intolerance of aspirin. On examination she has multiple soft, semi-transparent polyps within her nasal cavity.

A child is brought to casualty complaining of a headache and a sensation of pressure  between the eyes. On examination she is febrile with a smooth swelling overlying the  superomedial aspect of the right eye. The eye is uncomfortable and there is a purulent  discharge from the inner canthus
What is the Reason to give steroid to brain tumor before surgery?
A 9-year-old infant presented with fever and tender red mass below angle of mandible what is  your diagnosis?

A 64-year-old woman sustained a closed head injury. She is sedated and ventilated in the emergency department. A C.T scan of the brain shows significant cerebral edema Her intracranial pressure is elevated. Which of the following therapeutic strategies is most likely to lead to a rapid transient reduction in her Intra cranial pressure?
A 60-year-old man presents with a short history of pain in the right cheek and night upper teeth. Maxillary sinus infection is diagnosed, This sinus is particularly prone to infection because of:
Option 1: Absence of Celia on the epithelium lining the sinus
Option 2: Closeness of the sinus to the nasal cavity
Option 4: Position of the sinus ostium high on the medial wall
Option 5: Relationship of the front teeth to the floor of the sinus
Correct Answer: Position of the sinus ostium high on the medial wall

Question: A 30-year-old male presents with Sudden Unilateral exophthalmos, limited eye movement in all direction, congestions, exophthalmos and has a bruit, erythematous eye what is the most likely diagnosis?
A 40- year-old male presented with severe headache, vomiting and visual disturbance his CT showed Nonfunctioning pituitary macroadenoma what is your diagnosis?
A 60-year-old patient presented with headache and dizziness his CT showed Anterior Dural sac tumor with surrounding cyst capping what is you diagnosis?

A 29 year old man has had a sore throat for the past 5 days. Over the past 24 hours he has noticed increasingly severe throbbing pain in the region of his right tonsil. He is pyrexial and on examination, he is noted to have a swelling of this area and uvula shifted to another site. What is the most likely cause?
Child with high fever and neck spasm to one side with noisy breathing what is the diagnosis?
